subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Bachi}} [[File:Taikos_bachi.jpg|thumb|250px|{{m|ja|桴|tr=bachi}}: a selection of [[taiko]] '''[[drumstick]]s'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|ばち|yomi=k}} Might be a sound shift from ''buchi'' (see below), from the sense of {{m|en|strike|striking}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ぶち}}

Appears to be the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|打つ||tr=butsu|to strike something, to hit something}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ぶち}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ふち'|archaic|possibly|_|obsolete}} a [[drum stick]] for instruments such as the [[taiko]] and [[gong]], a [[percussion]] [[mallet]]

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Raft}} [[File:Isarfloss.jpg|thumb|250px|{{m|ja|桴|tr=ikada}}: a '''[[raft]]''' on a river in Germany.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|いかだ}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=いかだ|-}}. Found in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'', completed some time after 759 CE.{{RQ:Manyoshu|1|50}}, text [http://jti.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man1Yos.html#50 here] Appears to be a possible compound, but the ultimate derivation is unknown.
